intro: Ephippiorhynchium polycephalum, commonly known as the mountain orchid, is a rare and specialized plant belonging to the orchid family. It is characterized by its unique floral structure, featuring a single ovary with multiple ovules, which is a distinctive botanical trait. The plant typically grows in high-altitude environments, where it thrives in cool, moist conditions. Its morphology includes slender stems and lance-shaped leaves, adapted to its alpine habitat. Due to its limited distribution and specific ecological requirements, it is considered a botanically significant and ecologically sensitive species.
